titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1795 Nov. 24, Nashville [Territory South of the Ohio River, to] David Henley, Knoxville [Territory South of the Ohio River] / J.W. Overton : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Overton, J.W.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: 1795 Nov. 24, Nashville [Territory South of the Ohio River, to] David Henley, Knoxville [Territory South of the Ohio River] / J.W. Overton
bibl.author: Overton, J.W.
bibl.note: This is a letter from John Overton to David Henley, dated November 24, 1795. Overton is writing from Andrew Jackson's home. He is writing to inform Henley that he has accepted Mr. Searcy as contractor for an unmentioned project.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

list.item: Territory of the United States South of the River Ohio

div1.p: Since I wrote you I hav taken Bond of M- Searcy the Contractor- Andrew Jackson Anthony Foster and Andrew McMaury are his Securities
It will give me pleasure to hear by mr Searcy who will hand this, how you are, and inform me inform me when you go to the northward
